intro: Aeollanthus glandulosus, commonly known as the sticky leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its glandular hairs that give it a sticky texture, and its small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to white. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
